intro: Euphrasia bilineata, commonly known as the two-lined eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers with two distinct lines on the petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are square and often branched. Euphrasia bilineata is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
